item.title: Continuous Delivery
item.description: Continuous Delivery (CD) is deeply rooted in the first principle of the Agile Manifesto posted in 20011: Our highest priority is to satisfy the customer through early and continuous delivery of valuable software. According to Martin Fowler2, a project is truly embracing Continuous Delivery when: The software can be deployed at any stage of its lifecycle. The team values keeping the software deployment-ready over adding new features. Any software version can be deployed to any environment on-demand.
